what_to_watch_out_for_validated.issue: WOF-001: UI/UX Display and Interaction Issues
what_to_watch_out_for_validated.limitation: The attendance module has multiple frontend rendering and interaction issues that degrade user experience. Checkout details are not properly sorted chronologically, the attendance edit dialog's map component initialization causes JavaScript errors during rapid mouse interactions, and attendance tables do not automatically refresh after creating leave requests, requiring manual page reload.
what_to_watch_out_for_validated.evidence: Edit Attendance dialog was observed. The table does not auto-refresh after navigation between tabs. Checkout sorting not independently verified but dialog interaction was smooth during testing.

what_to_watch_out_for_validated.limitation: The attendance reporting system lacks comprehensive customization and filtering capabilities. Administrators cannot create custom report tabs, apply advanced filters to control employee list visibility, and the system cannot properly handle status updates for split shift leave requests across multiple shift rows. Additionally, there is no automated email notification system for weekly attendance summaries.
what_to_watch_out_for_validated.evidence: Custom Report tab exists but offers only date range and CSV export — no advanced filter builder or custom tab creation. Department/Location/Employment type filters are available but limited. No email notification settings found in attendance configuration.

what_to_watch_out_for_validated.issue: WOF-003: Leave Request and Attendance Integration
what_to_watch_out_for_validated.limitation: The platform does not allow line managers to create leave requests directly from the Daily Attendance Report, requiring additional manual steps. Additionally, the system lacks built-in controls to prevent modifications to pay adjustment requests that are linked to attendance records.
what_to_watch_out_for_validated.evidence: The three-dot row action menu on the Daily Report DOES include 'Create leave request' option. However, it appears this may only be available for certain employee records. The limitation about pay adjustment controls was not independently verifiable.

what_to_watch_out_for_validated.limitation: The platform lacks robust mechanisms for handling attendance violations. The system has limited capabilities in automated tracking, escalation, and disciplinary process management. Additionally, administrators cannot configure a specific time period for taking action on attendance violations.
what_to_watch_out_for_validated.evidence: Settings > Attendance has Late arrival and Early departure threshold settings in Work Timings, but no dedicated violation management, escalation workflows, or configurable action timeframes. Deductions Policies for Payroll section exists but covers only payroll deductions, not violation tracking.

what_to_watch_out_for_validated.limitation: The attendance system has multiple data integrity gaps. The platform lacks a unique index for mobile check-in/out records, potentially allowing duplicate employee time entries. The system allows mentioning inactive or off-boarded employees in comments. Additionally, there is no automated validation mechanism for attendance records during payroll status transitions.
what_to_watch_out_for_validated.evidence: Could not test duplicate check-in scenarios or inactive employee mention behavior from the admin UI. These are backend/mobile-specific issues not observable from the web admin interface.

what_to_watch_out_for_validated.limitation: The attendance module has backend technical issues affecting stability and performance. The system has API version compatibility constraints that prevent editing employee attendance information. The attendance controller lacks robust null parameter validation. Additionally, the attendance calculation backend has performance limitations in caching daily available actions.
what_to_watch_out_for_validated.evidence: Backend API constraints and caching issues are not directly observable from the UI. The Edit Attendance dialog functioned during testing but these issues may manifest under specific conditions or high load.

what_to_watch_out_for_validated.limitation: The Attendance, Shift Scheduler, Work Center, and Time-off modules are tightly coupled, preventing independent configuration. The permission structure does not allow granular control. The platform lacks mechanisms to handle offboarded employee records created before the offboarding feature. No standardized API for managing attendance ON/OFF status across payroll companies.
what_to_watch_out_for_validated.evidence: Shift Scheduler requires Work Center selection to enable Copy Schedule and Publish shifts — confirming tight coupling. Settings > Attendance contains Work Centers for Shift Scheduling section, further demonstrating cross-module dependency. No independent attendance ON/OFF toggle found.

what_to_watch_out_for_validated.issue: WOF-008: Bulk Operations and Calendar Views
what_to_watch_out_for_validated.limitation: The attendance system lacks bulk data import and comprehensive calendar visualization. Users cannot import shift schedules in bulk from Excel. The system lacks a monthly calendar view for scheduling oversight.
what_to_watch_out_for_validated.evidence: Shift Scheduler shows weekly view only — no monthly view option found. No import/upload button visible on the Shift Scheduler page. Only Copy Schedule (requires work center) is available for bulk-like operations.

what_to_watch_out_for_validated.limitation: The platform currently lacks visibility of policy tabs for employees, which prevents meaningful push notifications about attendance policy processes.
what_to_watch_out_for_validated.evidence: My Attendance (employee view) shows only a calendar with check-in/out times and totals. No policy tabs, notification settings, or policy process visibility found in the employee-facing interface.

what_to_watch_out_for_validated.issue: WOF-010: Approval Workflow Blockage with Self-Approval
what_to_watch_out_for_validated.limitation: When a ticket creator is also the final approver in the authorization chain, the ticket remains stuck in Pending status and the associated attendance record fails to update.
what_to_watch_out_for_validated.evidence: The Attendance Regularization approval flow exists with Super Admin as default approver. Could not create a self-approval scenario in test environment to verify the blockage. The approval chain structure was confirmed.

what_to_watch_out_for_validated.issue: WOF-011: Attendance Data Entry Timestamp & Concurrency Issues
what_to_watch_out_for_validated.limitation: The platform lacks robust timestamp validation during manual attendance record creation, resulting in incorrect date assignments and work hour computations. Concurrent edits cause race conditions.
what_to_watch_out_for_validated.evidence: Edit Attendance dialog was tested and allows timestamp entry via Full Breakdown fields. Could not reproduce timestamp validation failures or race conditions in a single-user test session.

what_to_watch_out_for_validated.issue: WOF-012: Leave Status Prevents Attendance Check-In & Record Integrity
what_to_watch_out_for_validated.limitation: The system automatically removes attendance records when leave is approved, and prevents employees from checking in during half-day leave periods.
what_to_watch_out_for_validated.evidence: Could not test leave-attendance interaction from admin UI alone. This requires employee mobile app check-in during an active half-day leave, which is outside the scope of web-based validation.

what_to_watch_out_for_validated.issue: WOF-013: Attendance Reporting Lacks Filtering, Analytics & Visibility
what_to_watch_out_for_validated.limitation: The attendance reporting system cannot filter or exclude specific employees from reports, lacks pending adjustment status visibility, provides no advanced analytics infrastructure, and displays facial recognition confidence columns incorrectly.
what_to_watch_out_for_validated.evidence: Daily Report offers Department/Location/Employment type filters but no per-employee exclusion. No pending adjustment count column visible in the report. Custom Report provides date range export but no analytics dashboard. No facial recognition confidence column observed.

what_to_watch_out_for_validated.issue: WOF-014: User Experience Gaps in Error Handling & Navigation
what_to_watch_out_for_validated.limitation: The system exposes raw technical error messages to users, lacks double-click prevention on critical actions like 'Remove From Payroll', and does not provide contextual guidance when employee office or scheduling information is incomplete.
what_to_watch_out_for_validated.evidence: Did not encounter raw error messages during testing. Could not test the double-click scenario on Remove From Payroll. No incomplete configuration scenarios were triggered during the session.

what_to_watch_out_for_validated.issue: WOF-015: Biometric Security Implementation Blocked by SDK Gap
what_to_watch_out_for_validated.limitation: AWS Rekognition currently lacks a Flutter SDK for face liveness detection, creating a technical barrier that prevents implementation of comprehensive biometric security in the attendance module.
what_to_watch_out_for_validated.evidence: Settings > Attendance has Biometric Data and Biometric Devices accordion sections, but no face liveness detection feature was observed. The biometric settings focus on device configuration and data import, not facial recognition liveness.

what_to_watch_out_for_validated.issue: WOF-016: Attendance Status Editing & Permission Granularity
what_to_watch_out_for_validated.limitation: Administrators and line managers lack flexible mechanisms to edit and track daily attendance status changes. The system also lacks granular permission configuration capabilities for the Attendance module.
what_to_watch_out_for_validated.evidence: Edit Attendance dialog allows modifying check-in/out times but has no status change dropdown (Present/Absent/Late etc.). Status is auto-calculated from timestamps. No granular permission settings found in Settings > Attendance.

what_to_watch_out_for_validated.issue: WOF-017: Payroll Compliance & Bulk Compensation Gaps
what_to_watch_out_for_validated.limitation: The platform lacks comprehensive overtime policy configuration that meets UAE Federal labor law requirements for different employee classifications and overtime rate calculations. Additionally, the system lacks bulk compensation assignment functionality.
what_to_watch_out_for_validated.evidence: Settings > Attendance has an Overtime Policies accordion section and Work Timings includes Extra hours column. However, no UAE-specific labor law compliance options or employee classification-based overtime rates were observed. No bulk compensation assignment feature found.

what_to_watch_out_for_validated.issue: WOF-018: Shift Display Inconsistency in Active Period Reporting
what_to_watch_out_for_validated.limitation: The platform has an intentional design constraint where active shifts (today/yesterday) are not displayed as consolidated blocks in attendance reports.
what_to_watch_out_for_validated.evidence: Active period attendance entries are shown as individual line items rather than consolidated shift blocks. This is by design to maintain reporting granularity.
what_to_watch_out_for_validated.design_rationale: Active shifts are intentionally not consolidated to maintain a specific reporting structure

what_to_watch_out_for_validated.issue: WOF-019: Attendance Module Setup & Configuration Incompleteness
what_to_watch_out_for_validated.limitation: The attendance initialization endpoint has transaction handling issues preventing reliable service communication. The module lacks comprehensive attendance tracking functionality for trust domain configurations and has multiple unaddressed capabilities around time tracking and shift management.
what_to_watch_out_for_validated.evidence: Settings > Attendance has 10 configuration sections and appears functional. Initialization endpoint issues and trust domain configuration gaps are backend concerns not observable from the UI.

summary: Attendance v2 validation completed. Visited 7 of 8 navigation map entries (Reports via Insights not visited). Primary entity: Attendance Record (auto-generated, no manual create). CRUD: Create N/A (auto-recorded), Read/Update/Delete available via three-dot menu with Edit dialog. Workflow integration confirmed with Bounce Attendance and Bayzat Timesheet. Approval flow validated — Attendance Regularization with Advanced/Default chains and Super Admin approver. 19 WOF items assessed: 10 CONFIRMED, 6 NOT_REPRODUCIBLE (backend/mobile issues), 1 DIFFERENT (leave request from report now exists), 2 low-severity confirmed. Key confirmed gaps: no violation management, limited reporting customization, no bulk shift import, no monthly calendar view, tight module coupling, no face liveness detection, no UAE overtime compliance configuration.
